sketch.title: Learning Theories Concept Map
sketch.description: 'How do we learn?' Learning theories describe how
sketch.goals_text: Learning the language of educators was an important reason for my interest in the MET program. In order to make connections between technology, students, and instructors it is important to have a good understanding of the context of the three.
sketch.reflection: Learning the language of educators was an important reason for my interest in the MET program. In order to make connections between technology, students, and instructors it is important to have a good understanding of the context of the three.

sketch.title: Neuroscience and Learning Introductory Course
sketch.description: This introductory course was developed to introduce our peers to the neuroscience of learning. My background is in psychology, so the development of the content and the course itself was also an opportunity to review some of these concepts myself, but to think about them from the perspective of course design, or in relation to other learning theories.

outline.title: Rationales for eLearning
outline.description: Educational technology can be adopted at multiple levels: in a classroom, a program, or an entire institution. This evaluation guaged institutional preparedness eLearning by examining institutional culture, preparedness, and infrastructure.

outline.title: Design Thinking Workshop
outline.description: In this paper and accompanying workshop, I propose that Design Thinking is an appropriate model to connect Constructivist theory with practical application. The workshop proposed that participants use an adapted Design Thinking process to plan a constructivist lesson.
outline.goals_text: how does this relate to my goals

outline.title: A Course Companion Website
outline.description: In ETEC 524 course we developed the structure of a course, as well as the structure of a module of that course. I used Moodle as my course shell, but determined it was important to have content that 'lived on' past the end of a course. So, I developed the majority of my content in this course companion website.
outline.goals_text: how does this relate to my goals

colour.title: This ePortfolio
colour.description: Throughout the MET program, I have most enjoyed being able to build tools. This ePortfolio is no exception, and the biggest challenge. This ePortfolio dynamically creates its content, including what you are reading now.
colour.connections: I have built two Wordpress blogs, one Moodle course with a custom companion website, and a Rise (Articulate) course. The development of the content for these websites made me curious about the 'behind the scenes'. There were some components of those websites that I have tried to build here (for example, the 'sliders' of more detail), but for the most part I was trying to build componenets that I thought would work to expand my idea of what an ePortfolio could be.
colour.goals_text: how does this relate to my goals
colour.reflection: I had hoped to do more writing and research throughout my courses - as this is not something I noramlly have much time for in my day-to-day. However, when the option was available to create something, that was the path I generally took.
